alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher; Logan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 9:04PM CDT until June 04 at 8:31PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Dover affecting Kingfisher and Logan Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Dover. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Rural lands and roads are covered by flood depths averaging almost a foot across Kingfisher County... and into western Logan County. Oil wells in lower places near the river channel are flooded or isolated. Livestock may become stranded by deeper flows in cutoff channels crossing the flood plain. Sandpit facilities near Dover could be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 17.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 11.0 feet Wednesday evening. It will rise to 11.1 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
